p: As shown in Table 6, the majority of participants chose physicians as the preferred source of information for the usage of medicinal plants to treat psychological disorders (81.8%), while (63.9%) of the participants considered nutritionists as the preferred source of information. In addition, other patients (47.3%), the internet (46.9%), family members (36.4%), and herbalists (34.3%) were the preferred sources of information for treating psychological disorders. Books and magazines were the preferred sources for 30.0% of the participants, while TV was the least preferred source of information for 25.2% of participants.
